result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas R Cliver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Huber allowed - can serve the sentence in any county in the State of WI as long as no cost to Forest County but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff(s).
Consecutive to: Any sentence that the defendant may currently be serving.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas R Cliver in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Nicholas R Cliver in custody.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:02 AM. Richards - resolved - plead G to count #1 as alleged and DRI remaining counts, joint recommendation of a withheld sentence and place on probation for 3 with conditions of: 9 months jail in FC Jail, fine $750.00 plus costs and surcharges, standard conditions. State agrees, AODA , no possession of alcohol, employment/school. Richards - asking that the defendant be able to serve the sentence in another county in the State of WI. State - sentence to run consecutive to any sentence that the defendant is currently serving. Richards agrees. Cliver agrees and understands. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3, goes thru plea questionnaire. Richards discusses with the defendant the difference between pleading G and NC. Cliver understands.  Cliver pleads G to count #1 as alleged as a repeater. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - follow joint recommendation. Richards - follow joint recommendation. Cliver makes statement - asks that treatment be ordered mandatory. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 9 months in FC Jail - consecutive to any sentence that the defendant is currently seving - counsel to submit a stipulation for credit within next 48 hours to COC and amend JOC when received - can serve sentence in any county in the State of WI as long as arrangements have been made - huber allowed, AODA and follow thru, $750.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - take bond posted - remainder due thru probation, maintain absolute sobriety for alcohol and illegal substances, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

Judge Kawalski appears telephonically from Langlade County. Defendant Nicholas R Cliver in court, in custody and with counsel Anne Kattee. No appearance from the State of Wisconsin. Called 3:19 PM. Court asks Katte how she would like to proceed due to non appearance from the State. Court suggests to delay until 8/7/14 in the morning. Clerk informs court that DA's office was aware of hearing today. Off record (3:26 PM) Recalled 3:28 PM, same appearances, Re-scheduled for 8/7/14 at 1:00 PM, clerk to notify DA. Officer John Thornton has just informed the court that Mr. Simono can be reached by telephone. Judicial assistant to call Mr. Simono and get Judge Kawalski back on the line and continue with hearing. Recalled 3:34 PM with Chuck Simono now appearing telephonically for the State of Wisconsin. Katte - reads charges and background to update court on the status of the case. Asks to reduced cash bond to signature bond. State - asks what Mr. Cliver can come up with before making his recommendation. State - concerned about being a flight risk and asks for $5000.0 0 cash bond to remain. Court - understands concerns of not returning to court, considers he had turned himself in, employment while on bond. Court - reduces bond to $500.00 cash. No conditions. Adj.
From attorney Katte regarding return from Lincoln County.
Bail/bond hearing on August 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 11:46 AM. Nicholas Cliver does not appear but his attorney Mary Burns does appear. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns - believes the defendant is currently incarcerated in the Lincoln Cty Jail - defendand had asked to appear by video but Burns did not believe it was possible due to it being a felony - would like to plead NG to all counts for the defendant - needs to withdraw as counsel for stated reasons. Court will continue bond, accepts pleas, set for FPT on 7/15/14 at 11:45 AM. Court grants verbal request to withdraw as counsel, clerk gives notice for defendant to Ms. Burns to get to SPD for appointment.

Called at 3:32 PM. Nicholas Cliver appears in person and in custody with attorney Mary Burns. State appears by Charles Simono. State - have just been advised that it will be a waiver of PH. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Called at 1:16 PM. Nicholas Cliver appears via video from Lincoln County Jail and his attorney Mary Burns appears in person. State appears by Charles Simono. Burns has complaint but has not gone over it with the defendant and he agrees to be heard by video today. Court reads charges and penalties. Burns - requests PH. State - bond - $5000.00 signature bond as defendant is on a PO hold. Burns - no objections. Cliver requests a cash bond. Court - bond - $5,000.00 cash, PH will be set for 3/19/14 at 3:00 PM, State will need to prepare writ. Court quashes the warrant.
